newsitem.title: UK: Alleged British war criminal has Alzheimer's - paper.
newsitem.headline: Alleged British war criminal has Alzheimer's - paper.

text.p: An 85-year old Belarussian refugee facing a war crimes trial in Britain has Alzheimer's disease, the Observer newspaper reported.
It said Szymon Serafinowicz would probably be found unfit to stand trial on charges of murdering Jews in Byelorussia (now Belarus) during World War Two.
A hearing preparing for Serafinowicz's trial -- to be Britain's first war crimes trial -- is scheduled for next week, on November 6.
But the Observer said psychiatrists would testify that the frail-looking Serafinowicz had Alzheimer's, an incurable and progressive brain disease that causes dementia and death.
Serafinowicz has said he is innocent of charges he killed the Jews in 1942 while commander of a German-organised police unit.
